metadata.feature_description: Process and render Markdown content in wiki articles

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create article with Wiki Link syntax

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki Test page and enter edit mode
steps.expected: Wiki module should display with article list and Create article button
steps.actual: Wiki module displayed with 4 existing articles and Create article button visible in edit mode

steps.action: Click Create article button to open article creation dialog
steps.expected: Article creation dialog should open with Title, Article Type, Content, and Tags fields
steps.actual: Dialog opened with all expected fields including plain text Content textarea

steps.action: Fill in article with wiki link syntax: [[Test Article for Metadata]], [[Click here|Test Article for Revision Management]], [[This Article Does Not Exist]]
steps.expected: Form should accept wiki link syntax in content field
steps.actual: Content textarea accepted wiki link syntax. Form was filled with Title='Markdown Test Article', Article Type='Concepts', Tags='test, markdown, wiki-links'

steps.action: Click Publish button to save the article
steps.expected: Article should be created and saved successfully
steps.actual: Validation error 'Text is required' appeared for Title and Article Type fields despite being filled. Article creation failed due to knockout.js binding issues

issues: Article creation dialog shows 'Text is required' validation errors even when fields are filled, preventing article creation. This appears to be a JavaScript/knockout.js binding issue where the validation does not recognize values entered via automated typing.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View Wiki Article with processed content

steps.action: Click on existing article 'Test Article for Metadata' from the article list
steps.expected: Article content should display with any wiki links processed into HTML anchor tags
steps.actual: Article detail page shows empty content area - only header, trial message, and footer are visible. Wiki module content does not render on article detail pages

steps.action: Enter edit mode on article detail page
steps.expected: Article content should be visible in edit mode with editor controls
steps.actual: Page remains empty even in edit mode. No Wiki module content or editor controls are displayed

issues: Wiki article detail pages do not render any content. The page shows only the site header, trial message, and footer. This prevents testing of wiki link rendering/transformation.

steps.action: Review MarkdownProcessor.cs source code to verify wiki link processing implementation
steps.expected: Code should implement [[Subject]] and [[Title|Subject]] wiki link syntax transformation
steps.actual: MarkdownProcessor.cs correctly implements: 1) SimpleTransform regex for [[Subject]] links, 2) ComplexTransform regex for [[Title|Subject]] links. Links to existing articles get 'dnnSocialLink' class, links to non-existent articles get 'wiki-nonexistent-article' class with subject attribute

observations: The 'Markdown Support' feature is actually a Wiki-style link processor, NOT standard Markdown. It only processes [[Subject]] and [[Title|Subject]] wiki link syntax to create inter-article links.
Standard Markdown features (headers, lists, code blocks, tables, images) are NOT supported. The editor uses a plain textarea or rich text editor, not a Markdown editor.
Wiki article detail pages appear to have a rendering issue - content area is completely empty in both view and edit modes. This may be a page template or module configuration issue.
The article creation dialog has a JavaScript validation bug where fields show 'Text is required' errors despite containing valid data.
Wiki module works correctly on the list page in edit mode, showing articles with titles, summaries, tags, and timestamps.
